queries.query_name: S3 Bucket ACL Allows Read Or Write to All Users
queries.description: S3 Buckets should not be readable and writable to all users

files.expected_value: 'acl' should equal to 'private'

queries.query_name: S3 Bucket Access to Any Principal
queries.description: S3 Buckets must not allow Actions From All Principals, as to prevent leaking private information to the entire internet or allow unauthorized data tampering / deletion. This means the 'Effect' must not be 'Allow' when there are All Principals

files.expected_value: aws_s3_bucket[wordpress_s3].policy.Principal should not equal to, nor contain '*'

queries.description: AWS DB Instance should have its storage encrypted by setting the parameter to 'true'. The storage_encrypted default value is 'false'.

files.expected_value: 'storage_encrypted' should be set to true

queries.description: Check if the redis version is compliant with the necessary AWS PCI DSS requirements

files.expected_value: aws_elasticache_cluster[wordpress_elasticache].engine_version should be compliant with the requirements

queries.query_name: S3 Bucket Allows Get Action From All Principals
queries.description: S3 Buckets must not allow Get Action From All Principals, as to prevent leaking private information to the entire internet or allow unauthorized data tampering / deletion. This means the 'Effect' must not be 'Allow' when the 'Action' is Get, for all Principals.

files.expected_value: aws_s3_bucket[wordpress_s3].policy.Action should not be a 'Get' action

queries.description: Checks if any static websites are hosted on buckets. Even static websites can be a liability when poorly configured.

files.expected_value: resource.aws_s3_bucket[wordpress_s3].website to not have static websites inside

queries.description: SNS (Simple Notification Service) Topic should be encrypted

files.expected_value: SNS Topic should be encrypted

queries.query_name: Sensitive Port Is Exposed To Entire Network
queries.description: A sensitive port, such as port 23 or port 110, is open for the whole network in either TCP or UDP protocol

files.expected_value: SSH (TCP:22) should not be allowed
HTTPS (TCP:443) should not be allowed
HTTP (TCP:80) should not be allowed

queries.description: Security groups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0:0 and/or ::/0

files.expected_value: One of 'ingress.cidr_blocks' not equal '0.0.0.0/0'
One of 'ingress.cidr_blocks' not equal '0.0.0.0/0'
One of 'ingress.cidr_blocks' not equal '0.0.0.0/0'

queries.description: Application Load Balancer should have deletion protection enabled

files.expected_value: 'enable_deletion_protection' should be defined and set to true

queries.query_name: ALB Is Not Integrated With WAF
queries.description: All Application Load Balancers (ALB) must be protected with Web Application Firewall (WAF) service

files.expected_value: 'aws_alb[wordpress_alb]' should not be 'internal' and has a 'aws_wafregional_web_acl_association' associated
files.actual_value: 'aws_alb[wordpress_alb]' is not 'internal' and does not have a 'aws_wafregional_web_acl_association' associated

queries.description: AWS Application Load Balancer (alb) should not listen on HTTP

files.expected_value: 'default_action.redirect.protocol' should be equal to 'HTTPS'

queries.description: It's considered a best practice when using Application Load Balancers to drop invalid header fields

files.expected_value: aws_alb[{{wordpress_alb}}].drop_invalid_header_fields should be set to true

queries.query_name: Auto Scaling Group With No Associated ELB
queries.description: AWS Auto Scaling Groups must have associated ELBs to ensure high availability and improve application performance. This means the attribute 'load_balancers' must be defined and not empty.

files.expected_value: aws_autoscaling_group[wordpress_ec2_asg].load_balancers should be set and not empty

queries.description: AWS CloudFront distributions should have logging enabled to collect all viewer requests, which means the attribute 'logging_config' should be defined

files.expected_value: aws_cloudfront_distribution[wordpress_cloudfront].logging_config should be defined

queries.description: All AWS CloudFront distributions should be integrated with the Web Application Firewall (AWS WAF) service

files.expected_value: 'web_acl_id'  should exist

queries.description: Check if CloudWatch logging is disabled for Route53 hosted zones

files.expected_value: 'aws_route53_query_log' should be set for respective 'aws_route53_zone'

queries.query_name: Cloudfront Viewer Protocol Policy Allows HTTP
queries.description: Checks if the connection between CloudFront and the viewer is encrypted

files.expected_value: resource.aws_cloudfront_distribution[wordpress_cloudfront].default_cache_behavior.viewer_protocol_policy should be 'https-only' or 'redirect-to-https'

queries.description: EC2 Instance should not have a public IP address.

files.expected_value: 'associate_public_ip_address' should be defined and not null

queries.description: EC2 Instance should have detailed monitoring enabled. With detailed monitoring enabled data is available in 1-minute periods

files.expected_value: 'monitoring' should be defined and not null

queries.description: ELB should have logging enabled to help on error investigation

files.expected_value: 'aws_elb[{{wordpress_elb}}].access_logs' should be defined and not null

queries.description: The HTTP port is open to the internet in a Security Group

files.expected_value: aws_security_group.ingress shouldn't open the HTTP port (80)

queries.description: IAM Database Auth Enabled should be configured to true when using compatible engine and version

files.expected_value: 'iam_database_authentication_enabled' should be set to true

queries.description: Make sure the AWS RDS configuration has automatic backup configured. If the retention period is equal to 0 there is no backup

files.expected_value: 'backup_retention_period' should be defined, and bigger than '0'

queries.description: RDS does not have any kind of logger

files.expected_value: 'enabled_cloudwatch_logs_exports' should be defined

queries.description: Server Access Logging should be enabled on S3 Buckets so that all changes are logged and trackable

files.expected_value: 'logging' should be defined and not null

queries.query_name: S3 Bucket Policy Accepts HTTP Requests
queries.description: S3 Bucket policy should not accept HTTP Requests

files.expected_value: aws_s3_bucket[wordpress_s3].policy should not accept HTTP Requests

queries.description: S3 bucket should have versioning enabled

files.expected_value: 'versioning' should be true

queries.query_name: Security Group With Unrestricted Access To SSH
queries.description: 'SSH' (TCP:22) should not be public in AWS Security Group

files.expected_value: aws_security_group[wordpress_ec2_sg] 'SSH' (Port:22) should not be public

queries.description: Every VPC resource should have an associated Flow Log

files.expected_value: aws_vpc[wordpress_vpc] should be the same as Flow Logs VPC id
files.actual_value: aws_vpc[wordpress_vpc] is not the same as Flow Logs VPC id

queries.description: VPC Subnet should not assign public IP

files.expected_value: aws_subnet[public_subnets].map_public_ip_on_launch should be set to false or undefined

queries.description: VPC should have a Network Firewall associated

files.expected_value: aws_vpc[wordpress_vpc] has an 'aws_networkfirewall_firewall' associated
files.actual_value: aws_vpc[wordpress_vpc] does not have an 'aws_networkfirewall_firewall' associated

queries.description: CloudFront web distributions should use custom (and not default) SSL certificates. Custom SSL certificates allow only defined users to access content by using an alternate domain name instead of the default one.

files.expected_value: Attributes 'ssl_support_method' and 'minimum_protocol_version' should be defined when one of 'acm_certificate_arn' or 'iam_certificate_id' is declared.

queries.description: ElastiCache should not use the default port (an attacker can easily guess the port). For engine set to Redis, the default port is 6379. The Memcached default port is 11211

files.expected_value: 'port' should not be set to 11211

queries.description: ElastiCache should be launched in a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)

files.expected_value: 'aws_elasticache_cluster[wordpress_elasticache].subnet_group_name' should be defined and not null'

queries.description: IAM Access Analyzer should be enabled and configured to continuously monitor resource permissions

files.expected_value: 'aws_accessanalyzer_analyzer' should be set

queries.description: RDS should not use the default port (an attacker can easily guess the port). For engines related to Aurora, MariaDB or MySQL, the default port is 3306. PostgreSQL default port is 5432, Oracle default port is 1521 and SQL Server default port is 1433

files.expected_value: aws_db_instance[wordpress_rds].port should not be set to 3306

queries.description: ElastiCache should have Redis enabled, since it covers Compliance Certifications such as FedRAMP, HIPAA, and PCI DSS. For more information, take a look at 'https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/mem-ug/SelectEngine.html'

files.expected_value: resource.aws_elasticache_cluster[wordpress_elasticache].engine should have Redis enabled

queries.description: AWS Shield Advanced should be used for Amazon Route 53 hosted zone, AWS Global Accelerator accelerator, Elastic IP Address, Elastic Load Balancing, and Amazon CloudFront Distribution to protect these resources against robust DDoS attacks

files.expected_value: aws_route53_zone has shield advanced associated
files.actual_value: aws_route53_zone does not have shield advanced associated

files.expected_value: aws_cloudfront_distribution has shield advanced associated
files.actual_value: aws_cloudfront_distribution does not have shield advanced associated

queries.description: It's considered a best practice for an EC2 instance to use an EBS optimized instance. This provides the best performance for your EBS volumes by minimizing contention between Amazon EBS I/O and other traffic from your instance

files.expected_value: 'ebs_optimized' should be set to true

queries.description: All outputs should contain a valid description.

files.expected_value: 'description' should be defined and not null
'description' should be defined and not null
'description' should be defined and not null
'description' should be defined and not null
'description' should be defined and not null
'description' should be defined and not null

queries.description: AWS services resource tags are an essential part of managing components. As a best practice, the field 'tags' should have additional tags defined other than 'Name'

files.expected_value: aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm[{{wordpress_cpu_alarm}}].tags should be defined and not null
aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm[{{wordpress_disk_alarm}}].tags should be defined and not null
aws_cloudwatch_metric_alarm[{{wordpress_rds_alarm}}].tags should be defined and not null

queries.description: It's considered a best practice for all rules in AWS Security Group to have a description

files.expected_value: aws_security_group[{{wordpress_ec2_sg}}].egress description should be defined and not null
aws_security_group[{{wordpress_ec2_sg}}].ingress description should be defined and not null
aws_security_group[{{wordpress_rds_sg}}].ingress description should be defined and not null
aws_security_group[{{wordpress_ec2_sg}}].ingress description should be defined and not null
aws_security_group[{{wordpress_ec2_sg}}].ingress description should be defined and not null
